There are some pretty cool hackerspaces/makerspaces in Berlin with diverse communities, awesome people, projects and events. But after months at Noisebridge in San Francisco and getting excited there about seeing people from diverse backgrounds and all skill levels working on awesome projects and supporting each other - I wonder:

- Can Berlin benefit from a new hackerspace?

-- even more diverse

-- even more welcoming to an international audience and the diverse people already living in Berlin

-- even more welcoming of beginners

-- even more awesome for the people who join the space


Would it make sense to start a new hackerspace for this? If yes: How should this space be?

Join the discussion and looking forward to see you all :)</root>

_description: Gathering of XMPP developers
_rawDescription:
Gathering of XMPP developers* vcard avatar on rooms - vcards avatars on pubsub nodes
* Tooling (Compliance Tester, TLS tester, uptime monitor -> aggregating to human readable short list of recommended servers)
* Exchange about the DOAP proposal by Link Mauve (contrary to the previous point, about implementation rather than deployments), see https://mail.jabber.org/pipermail/standards/2017-August/033123.html
* About e2ee, proposal to make https://xmpp.org/extensions/xep-0373.html#example-2 a separate XEP, and use it in OMEMO

Gathering of XMPP developers

<h level="2" i="1">== Proposed Agenda Items ==</h>
* vcard avatar on rooms - vcards avatars on pubsub nodes
* Tooling (Compliance Tester, TLS tester, uptime monitor -> aggregating to human readable short list of recommended servers)
* Exchange about the DOAP proposal by Link Mauve (contrary to the previous point, about implementation rather than deployments), see https://mail.jabber.org/pipermail/standards/2017-August/033123.html
* About e2ee, proposal to make https://xmpp.org/extensions/xep-0373.html#example-2 a separate XEP, and use it in OMEMO</root>

_description: youbroketheinternet/wefixthenet session to discuss and report progress on a secure, private post-Snowden era Internet

_workshopEvents._subtitle: Peer-to-Peer in JavaScript Against the Centralization of the Internet

_rawDescription:
The Internet hasn't been fixed yet, so we need another round of #ybti/#youbroketheinternet/#wefixthenet talks and discussion panels to present progress. Participating groups are GNUnet, secushare, net2o, and others working on secure networks and privacy are welcome, too.

Planned talks (add yours if you want to participate):


* 14:45 Bernd Paysan: net2o: GUI, realtime mixnet & ethical micropayment with efficient BlockChain
* 15:45 wldhx and intelfx: Matrix and usable messaging, today [15min]
* 18:00 Astro and mafintosh: P2P with JavaScript to defend against bad lawmaking [25min]
* 18:30 Twiddlebit: Die Programmiersprache Forth


We have several talks on 27th, because some of us are only available on that day, but we are meeting again on 29th for
additional talking and exchange!!

_description:
Privacy is the space in which ideas are developed, to retreat into whenever you want. This space is not only physical but digital as well. Governments and companies don't want to respect that so we become active ourselves.

The goal of this hands-on session is to pass on knowledge about protecting yourself in the digital space. This can include encrypted communication, preventing being tracked while browsing the web and general security advice for computers and smartphones.
_rawDescription:
Privacy is the space in which ideas are developed, to retreat into whenever you want. This space is not only physical but digital as well. Governments and companies don't want to respect that so we become active ourselves.CryptoParties are free and open for everyone, but especially ​those without prior knowledge, who haven't yet attended one.

CryptoParty is a decentralized movement with events happening all over the world. The goal is to pass on knowledge about protecting yourself in the digital space. This can include encrypted communication, preventing being tracked while browsing the web and general security advice for computers and smartphones.

To try the programs and apps at the CryptoParty bring your laptop or smartphone.Depending on available "trainers" we might offer:

* Communication Encryption
** Email (PGP)
** Chat (XMPP and OTR)
** Mobile Messenger
* Browsing
** Browser Add-Ons
** anonymous browsing (Tor)
* Data Encryption
** VeraCrypt (previously TrueCrypt)
** LUKS on Linux

All topics are offered for laptops and mobile phones and not limited to those mentioned above. Unfortunately not all tools are available for mobiles though. You can find a list of recommended apps and programs on https://cryptoparty.in/learn/tools.

Passwords and how to manage them is needed quite often and integrated into the other topics.

We also help you to install Linux or Tails (secure and anonymous operating system… please bring a thumb drive if interested).

Also worth a look:

* [https://securityinabox.org/en/ Security in a Box]
* [https://www.cryptoparty.in/learn/tools list of tools we recommend]

<h level="1" i="1">= About =</h>

<h level="2" i="2">== Why CryptoParty? ==</h>

Privacy is the space in which ideas are developed, to retreat into whenever you want. This space is not only physical but digital as well. Governments and companies don't want to respect that so we become active ourselves.

<h level="2" i="3">== What is a CryptoParty? ==</h>

CryptoParties are free and open for everyone, but especially ​those without prior knowledge, who haven't yet attended one.

CryptoParty is a decentralized movement with events happening all over the world. The goal is to pass on knowledge about protecting yourself in the digital space. This can include encrypted communication, preventing being tracked while browsing the web and general security advice for computers and smartphones.

To try the programs and apps at the CryptoParty bring your laptop or smartphone.

<h level="1" i="4">= Possible Topics =</h>

Depending on available "trainers" we might offer:

* Communication Encryption
** Email (PGP)
** Chat (XMPP and OTR)
** Mobile Messenger
* Browsing
** Browser Add-Ons
** anonymous browsing (Tor)
* Data Encryption
** VeraCrypt (previously TrueCrypt)
** LUKS on Linux

All topics are offered for laptops and mobile phones and not limited to those mentioned above. Unfortunately not all tools are available for mobiles though. You can find a list of recommended apps and programs on https://cryptoparty.in/learn/tools.

Passwords and how to manage them is needed quite often and integrated into the other topics.

We also help you to install Linux or Tails (secure and anonymous operating system… please bring a thumb drive if interested).

Also worth a look:

* [https://securityinabox.org/en/ Security in a Box]
* [https://www.cryptoparty.in/learn/tools list of tools we recommend]</root>
